title: Hiromitsu Horiike
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Horiike was born in <a href="Shizuoka%20Prefecture">Shizuoka Prefecture</a> on May 24, 1971. After graduating from <a href="Keio%20University">Keio University</a>, he joined <a href="Japan%20Football%20League%20%281992%E2%80%9398%29">Japan Football League</a> club <a href="FC%20Tokyo">Tokyo Gas</a> (later "FC Tokyo") in 1994. He played as regular goalkeeper from first season. The club results rose year by year and won the champions in <a href="1998%20Japan%20Football%20League">1998</a>. The club was promoted to new league <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> from 1999. In 1999 season, although he played as regular goalkeeper for 16 matches in a row from opening match, he injured his shoulder and left the match in 16th match against <a href="Hokkaido%20Consadole%20Sapporo">Consadole Sapporo</a>. After the injury, he could not play at all in the match behind <a href="Takayuki%20Suzuki%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201973%29">Takayuki Suzuki</a>. The club won the 2nd place in 1999 and was promoted to <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> from 2000. However the club gained <a href="Yoichi%20Doi">Yoichi Doi</a> and Horiike could hardly play in the match behind Doi. On July 8, he played from the 86th minute as substitute goalkeeper against <a href="Kawasaki%20Frontale">Kawasaki Frontale</a>. This match was his only match in J1 League and he retired end of 2000 season.
